qas.question: What year was it discovered that early LED instruments could be used for non-radio communication?
Who discovered non-radio uses for early LED devices?
The current in non-radio communication had to go through what type of component?
What other component was needed to detect the first current of a non-radio signal?
What final device was needed to hear the signal from the initial GaAs diode?
What year was it discovered that early LED instruments could be used for radio communication?
Who discovered radio uses for early LED devices?
The current in radio communication had to go through what type of component?
What other component was needed to detect the second current of a radio signal?
What first device was needed to hear the signal from the initial GaAs diode?

context: In <a0_0><b5_0>1957<b5_0/><a0_0/>, Braunstein further demonstrated that the rudimentary devices could be used for non-radio communication across a short distance. As noted by <a1_0><b6_0>Kroemer Braunstein<b6_0/><a1_0/>".. had set up a simple optical communications link: Music emerging from a record player was used via suitable electronics to modulate the forward current of <a2_0>a <b7_0>GaAs diode<b7_0/><a2_0/>. The emitted light was detected by <a3_0>a <b8_0>PbS diode<b8_0/><a3_0/> some distance away. This signal was fed into an <a4_0><b9_0>audio amplifier<b9_0/><a4_0/>, and played back by a loudspeaker. Intercepting the beam stopped the music. We had a great deal of fun playing with this setup." This setup presaged the use of LEDs for optical communication applications.
